syllabus:
**English III: Literature and Culture**

**文學與文化**

Spring 2019

Instructor: Jessie Shao 邵毓娟                  Email: [ycshao@ntnu.edu.tw](mailto:ycshao@ntnu.edu.tw)

Office: Cheng 808                             Tel: 77341800 ext. 1786

**I. Goals:**

本課程希望透過閱讀當代文學作品來探索世界與自我。選出作品都放置在某些主題之下，希望同學們藉由文學作品所開創出的不同文學視角來思考與人的處境相關等各式議題。課程中透過選讀由不同背景作家所書寫的當代作品，希望帶入不同的文化視野與思考。本課程企圖藉由文學與文化議題的討論，希望同學們藉由閱讀英文文學作品，除了培養英文的閱讀能力之外，能夠藉由閱讀發展出一種具有人文與哲理厚度與批判性的思考態度與方法。

The goal of this course is to provide students with a reasonably compact introduction to   the study of the social, historical, cultural, and personal issues rendered and explored in contemporary literary works. The selected works will be studied in terms of basic aesthetic elements and critical concepts and approaches so as to heighten students’ sensibility of the aesthetic, critical, and ethical dimensions of literary works. Reading literary texts alongside some significant and universal themes is meant to help students develop an in-depth view of literary works as an aesthetic expression of contested social, historical, and cultural conditions and of the complexity of humanity.

**II. Tentative Schedule:**

**Week 1 (Feb. 21):**

Orientation

Topic: Exploring the world through literature (Handout on basic elements of fiction)

**Week 2 (Feb. 28): No class.**

**Week 3 (March 7):**

Topic: Cross-cultural Encounters

Assigned Reading: “Interpreter of Maladies” by Jhumpa Lahiri

**Week 4 (March 14):**

Topic: Cross-cultural Encounters and Confrontations

“One out of Many” by V.S. Naipaul

**Week 5 (March 21):**

Topic: Cultural identity and self-identity: Chinese-American Experience

Assigned Reading: “Who’s Irish” by Gish Jen

**Week 6 (March 28): No Class**

**Week 7 (April 4): Oral Presentation**

Topic: Cultural Identity and Self-identity in a Multicultural World

**Week 8 (April 11):**

Topic: Love and the City

Assigned Reading: _Sure Thing_ by David Ives

**Week 9 (April 18):**

Catch-up Week

**Week 10 (April 25): Midterm Task: Group Performance**

**Week 11 (May 2):**

Topic: Equality and Individuality

Assigned Reading: “Harrison Bergeron” by Kurt Vonnegut, Jr.

**Week 12 (May 9):**

Topic: Religion, Faith, and Life

Selected Chapters from _Life of Pi_ by Yann Martel; Film-Viewing: _Life of Pi_ (2012)

**Week 13 (May 16): Oral Presentation**

Topic: My View on Harrison Bergeron and/or Pi

**Week 14 (May 23):**

Topics: Initiation Stories; Gender and Subjectivity 

Assigned Reading: “Boys and Girls” by Alice Munro

**Week 15 (May 30):**

Topic: Metaphors and Life (Excerpts from _The Postman_)

Topic on elements of poetry: Chapter 10: Speaker: Whose Voice Do We Hear 詩中的發話者; Chapter 11: Situation and Setting 詩中的情境; Chapter 12: Theme and Tone 主題與語氣; Chapter 13: Language: Word Choice and Order 詩的語言; Chapter 14: Visual Imagery and Figures of Speech 視覺意象與象徵的語言; Chapter 15: Symbol 象徵

William Carlos Williams: “The Red Wheelbarrow;” Sylvia Plath: “Metaphors;” Emily Dickinson: “\[I dwell in Possibility—\]; Kelly Cherry: “Alzheimer’s; Langston Hughes: “Harlem.”

**Week 16 (June 6): Oral Presentation**

Topic: Reflections on the Selected Readings

**Week 17 (June 13): Final Exam**

**Week 18 (June 20): Individual Conference**

**III. Requirements:**

1\. Finish each reading assignment in advance of each class meeting.

2\. Punctual attendance is required. Being late or absent with no reasonable excuse will cause the deduction of the term grade.

3\. Attendance and participation are important. Discussing these texts with the instructor and your peers will enhance your understanding of the texts.

4\. **Individual work:** 1\. Online forum: Students are required to respond to the topics on the online forum. 2. Oral presentations: Students are required to give 3 presentations on the topics related to the assigned works. 3. Final exam (an essay and a vocabulary test).

5. **Group work**: Midterm Task: In the Midterm week, each group is expected to perform a skit of their own creation. The performance is expected to be about 3-5 minutes in length.

**IV. Grading Policy**: Your grade will be given based on your performance on the following

aspects:

1\. Attendance and participation 30%

2\. Group Work 20%

3\. Individual Work 50%: Online forum (15%), oral presentations (20%), and final exam (15%).
